Description: Average number of years a person can expect to live.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths among residents under age 75 per 100,000 population (age-adjusted).
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths among residents under age 18 per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of infant deaths (within 1 year) per 1,000 live births.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Percentage of adults reporting 14 or more days of poor physical health per month (age-adjusted).
Percentage of adults reporting 14 or more days of poor mental health per month (age-adjusted).
Percentage of adults aged 20 and above with diagnosed diabetes (age-adjusted).
Number of people aged 13 years and older living with a diagnosis of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention

Description: Percentage of population who lack adequate access to food.
Percentage of population who are low-income and do not live close to a grocery store.
Number of drug poisoning deaths per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Percentage of adults who report fewer than 7 hours of sleep on average (age-adjusted).
Percentage of adults under age 65 without health insurance.
Percentage of children under age 19 without health insurance.
Ratio of population to primary care providers other than physicians.
Percentage of ninth-grade cohort that graduates in four years.
Percentage of teens and young adults ages 16-19 who are neither working nor in school.
Average grade level performance for 3rd graders on English Language Arts standardized tests.
Average grade level performance for 3rd graders on math standardized tests.

The extent to which students within different race and ethnicity groups are unevenly distributed across schools when compared with the racial and ethnic composition of the local population. The index ranges from 0 to 1 with lower values representing a school composition that approximates race and ethnicity distributions in the student populations within the county, and higher values representing more segregation.

The average gap in dollars between actual and required spending per pupil among public school districts. Required spending is an estimate of dollars needed to achieve U.S. average test scores in each district.
Ratio of women's median earnings to men's median earnings for all full-time, year-round workers, presented as "cents on the dollar."
The income where half of households in a county earn more and half of households earn less.
Source: Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates

Description: The hourly wage needed to cover basic household expenses plus all relevant taxes for a household of one adult and two children.

Measure: Children Eligible for Free or Reduced Price Lunch+
Description: Percentage of children enrolled in public schools that are eligible for free or reduced price lunch.
Index of dissimilarity where higher values indicate greater residential segregation between Black and white county residents.
Child care costs for a household with two children as a percent of median household income.
Source: The Living Wage Calculator; Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates

Description: Number of child care centers per 1,000 population under 5 years old.
Number of deaths due to homicide per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths due to suicide per 100,000 population (age-adjusted).
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of deaths due to firearms per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Number of motor vehicle crash deaths per 100,000 population.
Source: National Center for Health Statistics - Mortality Files

Description: Rate of delinquency cases per 1,000 juveniles.
Source: Easy Access to State and County Juvenile Court Case Counts

Description: Percentage of citizen population aged 18 or older who voted in the 2020 U.S. Presidential election.
Source: MIT Election Data and Science Lab; American Community Survey, 5-year estimates

Description: Percentage of all households that self-responded to the 2020 census (by internet, paper questionnaire or telephone).
Average traffic volume per meter of major roadways in the county.
Source: EJSCREEN: Environmental Justice Screening and Mapping Tool

Description: Percentage of owner-occupied housing units.
Percentage of households that spend 50% or more of their household income on housing.
Percentage of households with broadband internet connection.
Resident population.
Percentage of population below 18 years of age.
Percentage of population ages 65 and older.
Percentage of population self-identifying as non-Hispanic Black or African American.
Percentage of population self-identifying as American Indian or Alaska Native.
Percentage of population self-identifying as Asian.

Measure: % Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Description: Percentage of population self-identifying as Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander.
Percentage of population self-identifying as Hispanic.
Percentage of population self-identifying as non-Hispanic white.
Percentage of population aged 5 and over who reported speaking English less than “well."
Percentage of population that is female.
Percentage of population living in a rural area.

Focus Area: *Indicates subgroup data by race and ethnicity is available; + Not available in all states.
